message:
Guys, I have a question just for interest for the UI Designers and the UI Developers, How long approximately does it take you normally to get the first landing page designed/coded starting from being assigned on the task till you get it done?

I know that it depends on many factors, but I've been wondering for sometime how would my workflow be faster/slower than the others.

In another words, how can you know if it takes you longer or shorter than it supposed to take?

data.message:
If it's only a landing page... without complicated workflows or anything
Hmmmmm.. I would give it 2 to 3 days average
But again as you said it depends on soooo many factors and parameters
how could such question be answered :)  what you are asking is a relative thing not all landing pages are the same
Thanks Muhammad Saleh :) yes depends a looot..
Arabs Knight I know that it is very diffecult question.. but at the end of day  there is an average estimate time for the average page design/coding
Muhammad Saleh you mean for design or for coding?
your sketches are the only one that can tell u :)
Makes sense also :) ya Mohamed Alaa El Din

which case ?
1- PSD ready made design and you need to code it to html , CSS
2- No imagination and you have to do one then apply
3- imagination ( Specific Elements ) you have to built

what is no of sections in the design ?
1-  ( 2 : 4 )
2- ( 4 : 8 )
3- ( 8 : 10 )

what are the techs. ?
1- HTML CSS 
2- HTML5 CSS3
3- HTML5 CSS3 JS

It takes me about 3~4 days to make all templates initially (Usually the master/root template, homepage, 1 column and 2 columns templates) then after all website development is completed I spend about 1~1.5 day adjusting responsive stuff , testing, optimization, cleaning, styling new elements/components/widgets/templates that we added during the development .. etc.

Back to the days before modern browsers and before Bootstrap and similar frameworks, having to support IE, a lot of hacking and browsers incompatibilities, a lot of testing-fixing-F5 cycles on multiple browsers simultaneously it was taking more 5~6 days or so.

But you know it depends, sometimes a homepage might take 4 days if it has some special UI widgets, animations or new requirements or eftekasat.. etc.

The more clear requirements you get and the more wire-frames/design/concept you get that covers all cases and answers all the questions that popup in your mind during the implementation the more it becomes a piece of cake and takes less time and efforts even if the design is sophisticated.
Arabs Knight lets say the first case.. ready made psd and you need to code it to a responsive html5 css3 and js with 4 to 8 sections
Yehya Hafez I meant for coding only.. and I was talking about the average landing pages like what you might see on themeforest
Moutaz Shams thanks for such detailed reply. Very useful. Do you mean by to make all templates thd all deign templates like home page, about and so on?
Oh sorry Moutaz Shams now I get it :)

I mean the templates/master-pages plus the homepage. For other sub pages.. the majority usually contain simple links, images, paragraphs.. etc, a few of them contain stuff like galleries, grids, tabs.. etc but styling them does not take a long time because they will inherit a lot of styles. You know by completing the homepage and the main templates you complete the styles for links, headers, different types of buttons, sliders, icons.. lists, containers, bread-crumbs and maybe forms too and so on which makes other pages almost get automatically styled.

Am I slow or fast? I don't care because I believe that if I am slow and want to become faster I can easily do that by learning and practicing, I consider myself fast enough as long as I deliver the project on time and the client/boss is happy with the results.

If it is your boss who thinks you or your team is slow consider reading this:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/egyptian.geeks/permalink/851742001532176/

If its you who think you are slow consider reading this:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/egyptian.geeks/permalink/753488791357498/
Moutaz Shams - Very rich comment.. I will go through the 2 links.. thanks a lot
and yes.. it is just me who is not sure about how fast/slow would my work be

Yehya Hafez : about 15 : 18 hours

but this is a template for usage not for sale ,

to be for sale you need to duplicate the hours , so that you get the CSS optimized and the code as well
Sounds good Arabs Knight. It almost take us the same time
